intro: Calamus altiscandens, commonly known as the tall swamp canesedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. The plant features tall, slender stems that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a cluster of small, three-sided spikelets that produce tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Calamus altiscandens plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
